image.altText: Unidentified woman in foreground holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan with blue line around the scan

items.synopsis: An Australian woman caught up in a surrogacy scandal in Greece has spoken about her emotional ordeal as she desperately fights to be allowed to keep her baby.

title.children: Sarah has a baby due in October. She fears she may never get to meet it

image.altText: Green space with a creek, footpaths, trees, and people.

items.synopsis: New sports courts, water play areas and a nature playground are among the proposed new features for the corridor, which would link Watt Park, Woolloongabba Rotary Park and the Moorhen Flats.

title.children: Water play area and nature playground part of draft plan to revamp Brisbane inner-city creek corridor

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

items.synopsis: Police say one man has died and another has been injured in a 'targeted' shooting at Keilor Village in Melbourne's north-west.

title.children: Police confirm one man killed and another critically injured in 'targeted' shooting outside Melbourne cafe

image.altText: The lights of a police car flash in the foreground of a photo of a car crash

items.synopsis: Police say a driver arrested after last night's fatal incident in Melbourne's CBD is not in a fit state to be interviewed. One person died and five people were injured in the incident.

title.children: Police rule out terror link to Melbourne CBD incident, say driver unfit to be interviewed

image.altText: Cycling city Copenhagen sprints to become first carbon-neutral capital

items.synopsis: How did Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk become the proprietor of one of the most in-demand products in the world?

title.children: A Danish pharmaceuticals-maker has just become the biggest company in Europe — all because of one drug

items.synopsis: The epicentre in the High Atlas Mountains, known as Ighil, is in a region of small farming villages about 70km from the city of Marrakech.

title.children: At least 296 dead, 153 injured in magnitude-6.8 Morocco earthquake

image.altText: Sunshine Coast mega-mansion demolition

items.synopsis: The building, which had sweeping ocean views, was the centre of controversy for decades, with neighbours even launching a court bid to have the newly built palatial residence knocked down.

title.children: This 'extreme dream' McMansion with a nuclear bunker is being demolished. And neighbours are relieved

image.altText: Group of women look at plans for homes.

items.synopsis: An African migrant community and a group of older women are turning to co-housing developments in response to rising homelessness and being frozen out of the housing market.

title.children: Older women, migrants pool funds to purchase joint property in bid to overcome housing crisis

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman lying in bed looking exhausted

items.synopsis: People with myalgic encephalomyelitis, also known as chronic fatigue syndrome, say society has long underestimated and downplayed their struggles. They share what their lives are really like.

title.children: Dee feels like a prisoner in her own body and wants more people to know the truth about her illness

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

items.synopsis: The latest poll result for the Voice referendum shows more bad news for Yes with rapidly declining support across all demographics. For Yes to win from here it needs to turn things around fast and undecided voters are in the spotlight, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: These graphs show the stark difference between generations when it comes to the Voice

image.altText: Aerials skier Zakhar Maksymchuk performs a trick

items.synopsis: The world's top skiers are heading to Brisbane for the final leg of the International Ski and Snowboard Federation Grand Prix this weekend. It might be the first of many for more reasons than one.

title.children: Winter sports? In Brisbane? Why the world's top aerial skiers are in Queensland

image.altText: a composite image of photos of two teenagers, taken from behind

items.synopsis: The Palaszczuk government's swift apology on Tuesday after damning findings from the disability royal commission — although welcome — was lacking in detail.

title.children: The government apology to two brothers abused by their father was the easy part. Now the hard work begins

image.altText: An illustration of a person's hand placing a ballot paper into a ballot box held by someone else's outstretched hands.

items.synopsis: Conservative think tank Institute of Public Affairs has been accused of trying to "interfere with Australia's democratic processes via the education system" after publishing an "egregious" classroom resource about the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Voice classroom materials labelled 'shallow attempt to inflict conservative views' on school children

image.altText: A Melbourne Storm NRL player lies in agony holding his face after sustaining a leg injury.

items.synopsis: In just his third NRL match after more than a year on the sidelines, Ryan Papenhuyzen has surgery on a fractured right ankle, with the Melbourne Storm hopeful he will return to training in the new year.

title.children: 'We go again': Storm optimistic as Papenhuyzen undergoes surgery after short-lived NRL return

image.altText: Catherine King stands at lecturn in front of airport signage

items.synopsis: The government's Qatar decision isn't just about preventing Australians from accessing more flights at cheaper prices, but about the binfire that is our national carrier and its multiple failures to treat its staff and customers with respect, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The underlying problem behind the Qantas binfire

image.altText: Close up of spider with eggs

items.synopsis: You probably have a daddy-long-legs in your house right now – but there's so much about them that is commonly misunderstood. We bust five common myths.

title.children: 'Daddy-long-legs can't bite humans': Five myths about the spider that refuse to die

image.altText: A smiling woman in front of a black background.

items.synopsis: Cheryl Dedman is on a mission to raise awareness of fetal alcohol spectrum disorder — a topic she says people are reluctant to discuss.

title.children: Cheryl's adopted relative has fetal alcohol spectrum disorder. Here's what she wants you to know

image.altText: Two brown cows stare at camera in cattle pen on ship

items.synopsis: The Indonesian government has lifted its ban on live cattle and buffalo exports from Australia as concerns over over lumpy skin disease ease.

title.children: Australian live cattle trade to resume with Indonesia, bringing relief to industry

image.altText: A red stop sign in the desert reading: Stop, Extreme Heat Danger.

items.synopsis: Scientists are getting better at measuring the impact climate change is having on extreme weather events, with the Bureau of Meteorology getting ready to release climate attribution statements.

title.children: How scientists are modelling an 'alternative universe' to understand climate change's impact on extreme weather

image.altText: A woman smiling for the camera while working on hair

items.synopsis: Sunshine Coast hairdresser Eunice Krome has been cutting locks since she was 16. After more than 40,000 appointments she still sees her clients as "like family".

title.children: Eunice has been cutting hair for 60 years and has no plans to retire yet

image.altText: Adult hand holding a baby hand

items.synopsis: The NSW government says a new expert advisory group will be established to improve the birthing experiences of mothers, their partners and families.

title.children: 'Significant improvements' expected to maternity care after mums share heartbreaking stories

image.altText: Fire rages behind the canopy of both a eucalyptus and pine tree.

items.synopsis: From southern Europe to the east coast of the United States, debate is raging over how vulnerable the eucalyptus tree is to fire and whether it's doing more harm than good.

title.children: Australia's iconic eucalyptus was shipped across the globe. Now, this flammable tree has 'gone feral'

image.altText: A hand pulls a tap in a box to pour out red wine into a glass.

items.synopsis: Winemakers want consumers to stop the snobbery towards cask wine and embrace it as a climate-friendly and cost-effective alternative to glass bottles.

title.children: Some winemakers are putting their best wines in casks. They say it is better than glass

image.altText: Prince Harry with a beard looks down while wearing a dark suit and tie.

items.synopsis: The Duke of Sussex is snapped alone outside the noted royal mausoleum of St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle on Friday, one year to the day after his grandmother's death.

title.children: Prince Harry spotted leaving Queen's tomb on first anniversary of death

image.altText: Miley Cyrus laughing in black and white

items.synopsis: The former Disney star opens up about the trials and tribulations in her highly publicised career.

title.children: Miley Cyrus 'didn't make a dime' from her Bangerz tour, blesses Sinéad O'Connor after falling out

image.altText: Two older men playing pickleball with one man attempting to strike the plastic ball with his paddle.

items.synopsis: A cross between tennis, badminton and table tennis, pickleball emerged out of the US in the 1960s and continues to go from strength to strength in Australia.

title.children: This fast-growing game is quirky, easy to play and the saviour for some sports clubs

image.altText: a Glistening-green Tanager sits in the crest of a leaf

items.synopsis: Photos of two ducks in Peth and darter on a foggy winter morning in Victoria are among the winning entries this year.

title.children: Bird Photographer of the Year winners revealed

image.altText: Elon Musk with his hands clasped together.

items.synopsis: Elon Musk says he feared being complicit in a "major" act of war when Ukrainian officials requested he activate his Starlink satellite network in Crimea's port city of Sevastopol to aid an attack on Russia's fleet there.

title.children: Elon Musk says he rejected Ukrainian request to activate Starlink network, fearing he would be involved in conflict

image.altText: Lindsey Graham and Donald Trump at a rally

items.synopsis: A report released on Friday reveals that a special grand jury investigating efforts to overturn Georgia's 2020 presidential election results recommended indictments against a much larger group than prosecutors ultimately charged, including one current and two former US senators.

title.children: Georgia grand jury recommended charges against 39 people, including Lindsey Graham

image.altText: Construction workers stand along a train platform.

items.synopsis: We are now in a per capita recession: that is, output per person has been going backwards since the beginning of the year. Australians can't work any harder, so what's the solution, asks David Taylor.

title.children: Australians are working as hard as ever, but output is going backwards. Who's to blame?

image.altText: A middle-aged Ukrainian man in a tight combat polo shirt stands behind a podium in front of Ukrainian and Canadian flags.

items.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy alleges Russian leader Vladimir Putin was behind the death of mutinous mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin, who died in an unexplained plane crash with his top lieutenants last month.

title.children: Russia strikes Zelenskyy's home town as Ukrainian president lashes Putin

image.altText: A close-up photo of a baby gorilla sitting on an adult gorilla.

items.synopsis: There are only around 1,000 mountain gorillas left in the wild — and this vet is leading efforts to save them.

title.children: 'Everybody should wear masks': The unexpected threats for these endangered gorillas

image.altText: A woman and two men smile and clap in front of a group of people.

items.synopsis: Actor Sam Reid, who plays a TV news presenter in the series, admits he based his character on a real Australian journalist. And the creator of The Newsreader reveals which ABC journalist influenced another character on the show.

title.children: The ABC journalist who helped to inspire The Newsreader
